Probably the money that they saved from payroll by refusing to pay their workers a living wage... so that in addition to working they are still poor enough to qualify for public assistance... the result being that the rest of us taxpayers get to subsidize Wal-Mart's payroll . They also save money by refusing to have a large enough staff on duty to watch the floor and deter shoplifting... Meaning that in some cities as many as two officers pretty much spend their days dealing with crimes at Walmart... and the taxpayers pay for those police officers... Meaning that once again we are subsidizing Walmart's cost of doing business. Also... They save money by opening up all those self-serve registers so that they have fewer jobs to offer real people.
